title: Photon Angular Momentum and Zero-Point Oscillations
authors: Peter W. Milonni and G. Jordan Maclay
abstract:
Radiation from a localized, oscillating charge distribution can have angular
momentum that cannot be explained in classical electrodynamics. We consider the
simplest example -- electric dipole radiation of a single photon -- and show
that this angular momentum is attributable to zero-point oscillations in
unexcited states of the dipole source.
